member.name: T:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables
member.summary: Backup Azure Table to local file or blob storage.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, sets same connection spec for both the Azure Tables as well as the Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table and Blob Connections; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, accepts SecureString and sets same connection spec for both the Azure Tables as well as the Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table and Blob Connections

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, allows a different connection spec for Azure Table and Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

Connection string for Azure Blob Connection; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, accepts SecureString and allows a different connection spec for Azure Table and Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection as a SecureString
Connection string for Azure Blob Connection as a SecureString

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.BackupTableToBlob(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: Create a blob file copy of the Azure Table specified.
member.param: Name of Azure Table to backup.
Name to use as blob root folder.
Local directory (path) with authority to create/write a file.
True to compress the file.
True to validate the written record count matches what was queried.
Process will age files in blob created more than x days ago.
Set timeout for table client.
A list of Filter objects to be applied to table values extracted.
member.returns: A string indicating the name of the blob file created as well as a count of how many files were aged.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.BackupAzureTables.BackupTableToFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: Create a local file copy of the specified Azure Table.
member.param: Name of Azure Table to backup.
Local directory (path) with authority to create/write a file.
True to compress the file.
True to validate the written record count matches what was queried.
Set timeout for table client.
A list of Filter objects to be applied to table values extracted.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the file created.

member.name: T:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables
member.summary: Azure Tables copy functions.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, sets same connection spec for both the Source and Destination Azure Tables.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table and Blob Connections; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, accepts SecureString and sets same connection spec for both the Source and Destination Azure Tables.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table and Blob Connections

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, allows a different connection spec for Source and Destination Azure Table.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

Connection string for Azure Table Connection to be used as destination of Copy command; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, accepts SecureString and allows a different connection spec for Source and Destination Azure Table.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection as a SecureString
Connection string for Azure Table Connection to be used as destination of Copy command as a SecureString

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.CopyAzureTables.CopyTableToTable(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: This method will copy entries from SourceTableName to DestinationTableName. The destination table is NOT deleted first.
member.param: Name of table to copy from.
Name of table to copy to.
Set timeout for table client.
A list of Filter objects to be applied to table values extracted.
member.returns: A string indicating the result of the operation.

member.name: T:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables
member.summary: Azure Table delete functions.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, sets the connection spec for the Azure Tables.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, sets the connection spec for the Azure Tables.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection as a SecureString

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables.DeleteAzureTable(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will delete the table name specified. The operation will be considered successful even if the table name does not exist.
member.param: Name of table to delete.
Set timeout for table client.
member.returns: A string indicating the result of the operation.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables.DeleteAndRecreatedAzureTable(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will delete the table name specified and then recreate it.
member.param: Name of table to delete.
Set timeout for table client.
member.returns: A string indicating the result of the operation.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.DeleteAzureTables.DeleteAzureTableRows(System.String,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: This method will delete rows for the table name specified corresponding to the filter criteria. If no filter criteria is specified, all rows will be deleted.
member.param: Name of table from entries will be deleted.
Set timeout for table client.
A list of Filter objects to be applied to table rows to delete.
member.returns: A string indicating the result of the operation.

member.name: T:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter
member.summary: Container class for filter parameters to be used on Backup, Copy or Delete operations to remove records from the destination per filter values.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.#ctor
member.summary: Create an empty Filter object.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to create a Filter object with attributes set.
member.param: The option.
The Comparison value.
The Value.
The Join definition (optional)

member.name: P:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.Join
member.summary: The value to use to join the current Filter with the prior Filter

member.name: P:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.Option
member.summary: The Option for this filter, ex: PartitionKey

member.name: P:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.Comparison
member.summary: The comparison to use for the value specified.

member.name: P:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.Value
member.summary: The value of the Option.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.AreFiltersValid(System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: Tests whether the list of Filter objects passed are valid filters. Contextual checks (ex: join must be an empty string on first in list, and populated on others) are made.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.IsValidFilter(TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter)
member.summary: Tests whether the passed Filter object is valid. Note that a filter may be valid for use alone, but not work in a list (ex: Join value must match context of placement in list)

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.IsValidOption(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the string passed is a valid filter option.
member.param: Valid values are PartitionKey, RowKey and Timestamp.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.IsValidComparision(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the string passed is a valid comparison operator for the filter.
member.param: Valid values are =, ==, Equal, !=, <>, NotEqual, >, GreaterThan, >=, GreaterThanOrEqual, <, LessThan, <=, LessThanOrEqual

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.IsValidTimestamp(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the string passed is a valid Timestamp; .Net DateTimeOffset is used for validation.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.IsValidJoin(System.String)
member.summary: Tests if the string value passed is a valid Join operator for the filters.
member.param: Valid values are empty string, AND, OR

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.ConvertComparisonToOperator(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string containing a Filter compartison value into the value used for the Azure where clause.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter.BuildFilterSpec(System.Collections.Generic.List{TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Filter})
member.summary: Build the "Where" clause for the query call of the table being extracted.

member.summary: Common method for AzureTableUtilities

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.Helper.IsSecureStringNullOrEmpty(System.Security.SecureString)

member.name: T:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables
member.summary: Restore local file or blob file to Azure Table.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, sets same connection spec for both the Azure Tables as well as the Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table and Blob Connections; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, sets same connection spec for both the Azure Tables as well as the Azure Blob storage.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor, allows a different connection spec for Azure Table and Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

Connection string for Azure Blob Connection; ex "AccountName=devstoreaccount1;AccountKey={xxxxxxxxxxx};DefaultEndpointsProtocol=http;BlobEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10000/devstoreaccount1;QueueEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10001/devstoreaccount1;TableEndpoint=http://127.0.0.1:10002/devstoreaccount1;"

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.#ctor(System.Security.SecureString,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Constructor, accepts SecureString and allows a different connection spec for Azure Table and Azure Blob storage.
member.param: Connection string for Azure Table Connection as a SecureString
Connection string for Azure Blob Connection as a SecureString

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.RestoreTableFromBlob(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Restore file created in blob storage by BackupAzureTables to the destination table name specified.
member.param: Name of the Azure Table to restore to - may be different than name backed up originally.
Name of the Azure Table originally backed (required for determining blob directory to use)
Name to use as blob root folder.
Local directory (path) with authority to create/write a file.
Name of the blob file to restore.
Set timeout for table client.
member.returns: A string indicating the table restored and record count.

member.name: M:TheByteStuff.AzureTableUtilities.RestoreAzureTables.RestoreTableFromFile(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Restore file created by BackupAzureTables to the destination table name specified.
member.param: Name of the Azure Table to restore to - may be different than name backed up originally.
Complete file name and path containing the data to be restored.
Set timeout for table client.
member.returns: A string indicating the table restored and record count.
